TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SqlCacheDependencyAdmin extends System.Object
public ref class SqlCacheDependencyAdmin abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Performs administrative tasks required on a SQL Server database to support the class when using polling-based dependencies. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the methods of this class to programmatically enable and disable a SQL Server database and its tables for <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object change notifications. In addition, this class obtains information about which tables in a database are enabled for change notifications using the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.GetTablesEnabledForNotifications%2A> method. However, you can also use the Aspnet_regsql command-line tool to manage change notifications for a SQL Server database and its tables.
> [!NOTE] > To call any of the methods in this class, the account you use to access the SQL Server database must have permissions to create tables and stored procedures. To enable notifications on a specific table, you must have permissions to create a SQL Server trigger on that table. For more information on how to set permissions on a database, see the SQL Server documentation. For more information about the account used by the ASP.NET process, see [ASP.NET Impersonation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a0cb3024-562f-4184-9d3c-095504787d3d).
## Examples The following code example is a simple ASP.NET page for enabling and disabling change notifications on SQL Server database tables. It uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> object to manage change notifications in the database specified in a connection string called `MyConnectionString`. The example includes two files, an .aspx file that defines the user interface and a code-behind file containing the source code for the ASP.NET events.
The first sample is the .aspx file that defines the user interface.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This example has a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07).
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/CS/cacheDependencyAdmincs.aspx#10)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/cacheDependencyAdminvb.aspx#10)]
The second sample is the code-behind file containing the source code for the page events.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/CS/cacheDependencyAdmincs.aspx.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/cacheDependencyAdminvb.aspx.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
Docs.summary: Disables change notifications for the specified database.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method removes support for change notifications from the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter. Once you have run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method, you must run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method if you wish to re-enable change notifications for a database.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method to disable change notifications for the database specified by the connection string `MyConnectionString`.
For the full code required to run the example, see the Example section of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> class overview topic.
[!code-vb[CachingSamples_SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CachingSamples_SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/sqlcachedep2vb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception:
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.

Docs.summary: Disables change notifications on a SQL Server database table or an array of database tables.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The database table on which to disable change notifications.
Docs.summary: Disables change notifications on a SQL Server database table.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method disables change notifications for the table specified in the `table` parameter, which must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.
Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method to disable change notifications for a table, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to re-enable change notifications.
## Examples The following code example disables change notification on a table specified in the connection string `MyConnectionString`.
For the full code required to run the example, see the Example section of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> class overview topic.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/CS/cacheDependencyAdmincs.aspx.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/cacheDependencyAdminvb.aspx.vb#7)]

Docs.exception: The database is not enabled for change notifications.

A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.

Docs.param: A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The array of SQL Server database tables on which to disable change notifications.
Docs.summary: Disables change notifications on an array of SQL Server database tables.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method removes change notifications from the tables specified in the `tables` parameter. These tables must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.
Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method to disable change notifications for a list of tables, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to re-enable change notifications.

Docs.exception: The database is not enabled for change notifications.

One of the values in the parameter is .
-or-
One of the values in the parameter is an empty string ("").

A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.

Docs.param: A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
Docs.summary: Enables change notifications on the specified database.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method adds support for change notifications from the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter. Once you have run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method, you must run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method if you wish to disable change notifications for a database.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method to enable change notifications for the database specified by the connection string `MyConnectionString`.
For the full code required to run the example, see the Example section of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> class overview topic.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/CS/cacheDependencyAdmincs.aspx.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/cacheDependencyAdminvb.aspx.vb#3)]

-or-

-or-

Docs.summary: Connects to a SQL Server database and prepares a database table or tables for change notifications.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The database table on which to enable change notifications.
Docs.summary: Connects to the specified SQL Server database and enables the specified database table for change notifications.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method adds change notifications for the table specified in the `table` parameter, which must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.
Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method to add change notifications to a table, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to disable change notifications.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method to enable change notifications on the specified table in the database specified in the connection string `MyConnectionString`.
For the full code required to run the example, see the Example section of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> class overview topic.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/CS/cacheDependencyAdmincs.aspx.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/cacheDependencyAdminvb.aspx.vb#7)]

-or-

-or-

The array of SQL Server database tables on which to enable change notifications.
Docs.summary: Connects to the specified SQL Server database and enables the specified array of database tables for change notification.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method adds change notifications for the tables specified in the `tables` parameter. These tables must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.
Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method to add change notifications to a group of tables, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to disable change notifications.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method to enable change notifications on the tables specified in a semicolon-delimited list in the database specified in the connection string `MyConnectionString`.
For the full code required to run the example, see the Example section of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> class overview topic.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/CS/cacheDependencyAdmincs.aspx.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin/VB/cacheDependencyAdminvb.aspx.vb#7)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.GetTablesEnabledForNotifications%2A> method returns a string array containing the names of all tables in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter that are enabled for change notifications.
## Examples The following code example creates a string array of the tables enabled for change notifications in the database specified in the connection string `MyConnectionString`.
For the full code required to run the example, see the Example section of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin> class overview topic.
